wikipedia_page.main: Peter Grant (born 12 October 1960) is a Scottish politician who has served as a Member of Parliament from Glenrothes as a member of the Scottish National Party since his election in the 2015 general election.

response: The seat is currently held by Peter Grant, of the Scottish National Party (SNP). He has held the seat since the 2015 general election after gaining the seat from the Labour Party who had held the seat since its creation.

| Peter Grant MP (Scottish National)

The Labour party candidate was Kirkcaldy High School rector Lindsay Roy.Top 40 Scottish Blogs, Ian Dale's Diary, 27 August 2008  The SNP selected the leader of Fife Council, Peter Grant.SNP reveals by-election candidate, BBC News, 22 August 2008 The Conservative Party selected Maurice Golden while the Liberal Democrats chose Harry Wills.Steve Bargeton, "MP's death leaves battle for Brown ", The Courier  The Scottish Socialist Party stood Morag Balfour, their national co-chair, who lived in Glenrothes and had been a candidate in the constituency before.Simon Johnson, "John MacDougall was suing Government over disease that killed him", The Daily Telegraph, 24 August 2008  Solidarity stood Louise McLeary, a community activist who lived in the part of Kirkcaldy which lies inside the constituency. The UKIP candidate was Dr. Kris Seunarine a specialist in the science of biophotonics at Dundee university, and chairman of the Fife branch of UKIP.
